summary: The "Holding Nonprofit Hospitals Accountable Act" (H.R. 3019) amends the Internal Revenue Code to establish new community benefit standards for tax-exempt hospitals. It mandates that hospitals have community-based boards, treat patients using public programs without limiting their access, and spend a certain amount on patient care improvements and financial assistance. The bill also includes provisions for reviews of financial assistance policies and IRS enforcement, along with effective dates for the changes.
